PARAGRAPH.STRING: ([lɛx vaˈwɛ̃sa]; in English often [IPA: ['lɛk və'lɛsə]]; born September 29 1943, Popowo, Poland) is a Polish politician, a former trade union and human rights activist, and also a former electrician.
co-founded Solidarity (Solidarność), the Soviet bloc's first independent trade union,
won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1983, and
served as President of Poland from 1990 to 1995 (succeeded by Aleksander Kwaśniewski).
